commit_message:
Improve summary counts

It is useful to have ta count of correct/incorrect and total as well.
Should probably add something about never run and such.
Update gitignore
Make summary csv easier to read
Also write fasta of skipped sequences
Do not automatically delete expensive files
Update sums
Add brief notes on current summary
Modify searching scripts

Use streams not lists

By using streams we don't have to fit all the data in memory at once.
This is really useful in making the scripts faster and use less memory.
This requires reworking how everything is structured though.
Add filter option to fasta.py
Ensure we always have at least 1 job
Whoops forgot some stuff

Many improvements

This now computes the targets.fasta file for all the organism here. In
addition it will compute the psl files on the cluster and then can
generate the hits file as needed.
Update ignores

Add script to guess number of jobs

Basically we want to use as many as possible to minimize the overall
runtime while staying within the allowed limits. If running with bsub
then we should use up to 100, while locally I limit to 4.
Add some bad-ids
Implement polling to wait for remote jobs
Update gitignore

Begin work on script to execute blat remotely

This is a script which will either run blat locally or remotely
depending upon settings in the environment. I think I can slot this into
the normal matcher and have it work to run blat on the server and the
parse results locally. It isn't finished yet as I need to test the
sleep/poll loop for detecting a finished job.
Clean up temp files

Add more organisms to map

In theory this all works correctly. However, while it can map may of the
unknown sequences it takes too long to map the known ones. This means it
is impossible for me to validate if the selected approach works well.
So I can't really trust the mappings. I will rewrite the mapping logic
to use the cluster and hopefully that will make things efficient enough
that I can actually work with them.
Initial addition of required worm files

Rework to a Makefile approach

This now can do the pombe mapping using the Makefile. This should be
easy to extend to a new organism like C. elegans. I also reduce the
amount of stuff in the repo so this is easier to clone. This probably
makes it less reproducible as it is possible that the genomes and such
will change without our knowing.

Begin work on mapping C. elegans

I want to reuse lots of the logic I already have but that is proving
annoying using shell scripts. So I'm moving to a hopefully more reusable
Makefile based approach. This doesn't yet work but does outline what I
think the generic Makefile will be.

The general idea is that most of the logic is the same cross organisms,
the only bit that is different is where to get input
sequences/coordinates and how to do the mapping. I think using a
Makefile I can more or less enforce this.

This is my initial attempt at this. Nothing will work yet but this is
the start of how I will try to move things.

Fix best-match logic

Best match now does more or less the right thing and we take advantage
of it to find the missing coordinates. The idea is to take as many of
the best hits as we can but never take any bad hits. Right now I have it
set to 99% as the minimum allowed difference and 100% query
completeness. This seems to let us match nearly all the unknown
sequences with very few issues compared to 100% match on the known hits.

Improve best match method

This is closer to being correct now.

Correct bugs and add new matcher

There were some bugs with how various things were computed. I've
reworked the data to reflect this.

Also I've begun work on a new matcher best-match. This basically takes
as many of the best hits as possible and then will take up to a
specified number of less good hits.
Correct logic of using defines
Add an editor config
Write to valid insterable json
Unzip fasta file and create new format
Compute the unknown coordinates as well
Update gitignore
Show how this actually works in the readme
Update paths and such to be easier to work with

Improve detection of splicing

This does a better job of finding spliced vs unspliced for both hits and
features. This is pretty helpful when examining the results to see why
there are incorrect matches. I've also improved the detection of
identity so it will require 100% identity, not just 0 gaps in the
alignment.

The splicing detection does rely upon the feature of BLAT where it
writes out multiple HSPfragments, so it likely won't work with BLAST.
Not ideal and should be improved. Summarily, the computation of identity
requires a BLAT output.

Also some spelling fixes and the like.

Improve detection of hits

This does a better job of detecting where hits belong. We have probably
increased the false positive (extra hits) a bit but that is ok for now.
I suspect the false positives are just spliced vs unspliced hits. With
the improved parsing I can probably detect these cases and mark them
separately.

Minor update to name

Just to follow the naming conventions I have.

Better parsing of hits

We can now pull out the fragments that some programs create. This will
provide a better idea of exon/intron structure and hopefully let me
evaluate the hits better.

Improve naming and flush sequences

Sequences must be flushed so we are sure that we are searching all data.
Add some notes on missing locations
Move notes around
Write gff3 of missing locations
Correct attribute naming
Add more mappers
Rename upi to uri
Rename upi to uri
Cleanup script

Improve genome mapping in a variety of ways

This does a better and more straightforward way of comparing to the
known. I've also added the ability to pull out the best match within a
range. This is useful in a variety of ways.

Yet more improvements

This can now correctly extract all sequences from the genome, check that
the right sequences were found and then run searches. This requires lots
of changes, including this like removing entries where the range and
sequence do not match as well as lots of other issues.

Make analysis more or less reproducible

This fixes issues where the bed files were not 0 based but instead 1
based. In addition, I do not exclude a few (4) sequences where the
location information is from silva. This because the location
information is wrong. Also, I convert sequences to RNA so that the blast
search works as expected.
Update gitignore
Add correct hash for md5 hashes

Attempt to validate md5 hashes of targets

This attempts to validate that the md5 hashes of sequences is correct.
However, right now this will fail as the BED file are 1 based when they
should be 0 based. This is a bug that needs to be fixed.

Add script to do pombe analysis

This is my start at making this stuff reproducible and make it easier to
see where all the data came from. In addition, I've starting doing
something that may be odd. That is I am using the downloaded .bed file
and bedtools to extract the sequences of molecules that have genome
coordinates. Depending on the genome used this may not produce the same
sequences as what is in rnacentral, which is odd. This should be checked
as part of the script as well.
Ignore some stuff
Improve gff3 formatting

Update data

I am now going to be using a script to fetch the data. This updates the
stored data to match what is fetched.
Rename script
Shorten building locals

Better storage of features

We can more or less store the Features from gff now.

Refactor and add new features

Some of this is useful stuff (ignoring all warnings) and others are me
being a bit cute (parsing strings on the command line into python code
to provide a generic filter). I've also fixed the bug where things are
marked as 'UNKNOWN', I forgot the whole elif structure. I've also
reworked formatting to allow a more generic style and added some limited
ability to write gff3 data.

Still this is organized a bit better, has more useful features and fixes
a bug.
Updates
Some changes to write out shift
Stopping for now

Major refactor

Basic reworked all of this, plus some notes and stuff.

Updates

A better version in terms of output and the shift comparisons.
Add some more notes and thoughts

Update call to blat

Blat requires the -q=rna option in order to properly find RNA sequences
of course. This is the reason why I do not get prefect recall for all
the known positions.

Creating working script

This script can map sequences to a genome. It has been tested for the
case of S. pombe. The idea is to use BLAT to map to the genome and only
accept the hits which are exact. So far it does ok. A full discussion of
how it does will be in the notes.
Add basic readme, not correct yet
Add note about numbering
Update pombe data

Add some notes on variant calling

This may be a useful approach so I should note it.

Make a version that runs

While this does not actually make the correct mappings, it does now actually
run and parse everything. That said it is not producing correct mappings
yet.
Update requirements file
First attempt at dockerizing
Move notes
Move some code around

First pass at general code

This is my first pass at creating the code to produce mappings to the
genome. Nothing works, probably but it is a start.
Add some sample data from pombe

Updates

Add some more complete details. I think this will be enough to start a
discussion of what to do.
First version
